page.title: 01LLANDRINDOD WELLS
page.content: Llandrindod Wells is a small town of some 4,000 inhabitants set in the heart of rural Wales, nestling peacefully on the banks of the River Ithon. It is situated in the county of Powys (formerly Radnorshire) and is now the Administrative Headquarters of the new county.The town itself has a very Victorian air about it due mainly to the popularity of the Spa Waters at the turn of the century. At that time it was a thriving and prosperous community and its impressive architecture is a legacy of this period. The surrounding area is almost totally rural with farming and tourism together with the Local Government Headquarters being the major form of employment in the area.
